data.title: Bruce Hornsby & The Noisemakers
data.meta_description: Bruce Hornsby & The Noisemakers: Spirit Trail 25th Anniversary Tour Wednesday, September 18, at 7:30 PM on the main stage at GPAC. Co-presented by Mempho Presents Bruce Hornsby has built one of the most diverse, collaborative, and adventurous careers in contemporary music. Drawing from a vast wellspring of American musical traditions, the singer/pianist/composer/bandleader has created a large and accomplished body of work and employed a vast array of stylistic approaches.  Hornsby’s 23 albums have sold over 11 million copies worldwide, and he has appeared on over 100 records including releases with Bob Dylan, Don Henley, Stevie Nicks, Ricky Skaggs, Bob Seger, Chaka Khan, Bon Iver, Brandon Flowers, Bonnie Raitt, Sting, Mavis Staples, Willie Nelson, and more.  “We are elated to present Bruce Hornsby & The Noisemakers’ 25th-anniversary celebration of Spirit Trail, and we can’t wait to welcome Bruce back to GPAC.” —Paul Chandler, GPAC Executive Director.
data.text:
Bruce Hornsby & The Noisemakers: Spirit Trail 25th Anniversary Tour

Wednesday, September 18, at 7:30 PM on the main stage at GPAC.

Co-presented by Mempho Presents

Bruce Hornsby has built one of the most diverse, collaborative, and adventurous careers in contemporary music. Drawing from a vast wellspring of American musical traditions, the singer/pianist/composer/bandleader has created a large and accomplished body of work and employed a vast array of stylistic approaches.

Hornsby’s 23 albums have sold over 11 million copies worldwide, and he has appeared on over 100 records including releases with Bob Dylan, Don Henley, Stevie Nicks, Ricky Skaggs, Bob Seger, Chaka Khan, Bon Iver, Brandon Flowers, Bonnie Raitt, Sting, Mavis Staples, Willie Nelson, and more.

“We are elated to present Bruce Hornsby & The Noisemakers’ 25th-anniversary celebration of Spirit Trail, and we can’t wait to welcome Bruce back to GPAC.” —Paul Chandler, GPAC Executive Director.
